head.supplied: Premiers Office ¶ 19.3.97 ¶ Dear Mr Topp ¶ ¶ The Premier asks that you will kindly refrain from doing anything in the case of the gratuity of 9 months pay proposed to be given to Baron Von Muellers E...

div.p: From Robert Rogers to Charles Topp
F97/4027, unit 972, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

The Premier asks that you will kindly refrain from doing anything in the case of the gratuity of 9 months pay proposed to be given to Baron Von Muellers Executors until you have seen Mr Meakin who has some conditions to mention to you which Sir George Turner wishes to impose in connection with the gratuity.

Have you not also some claim for Government property in the hands of the Executors?
See W. Potter to C. Topp, 27 March 1897 (in this edition as M97-03-27).
